thread.title: Fears mystery man seen with Tara Palmer-Tomkinson in weeks before death 'may have been drug dealer'
thread.title_full: Fears mystery man seen with Tara Palmer-Tomkinson in weeks before death 'may have been drug dealer'

author: Steve Robson
title: Fears mystery man seen with Tara Palmer-Tomkinson in weeks before death 'may have been drug dealer'
text:
Tara Palmer-Tomkinson was found dead in her flat aged 45 (Photo: AFP) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Friends fear a mystery man seen with Tara Palmer-Tomkinson in the weeks before her death could have been a drug dealer. 
Tara was found dead in her London flat on Wednesday aged 45. 
Her death is being treated as "unexplained" but non suspicious by police. 
The former It girl was known to have had health problems including a benign brain tumour and a rare auto-immune disease. 
But friends also fear she had recently fallen back into old habits, having struggled to have kicked a cocaine habit for most of her life. Tara Palmer Tomkinson and singer Mick Hucknall in 1999 (Photo: Rex Features) Tara Palmer-Tomkinson as a Dr No Bond girl Ursula Andress in 1998 (Photo: Rex Features) 
Just weeks ago she told a friend: "I’m doing everything I can to stay clean, but therapy isn’t enough any more." 
There have been reports Tara was seen in her local pub with a mystery older man. 
It had been believed this may have been a new boyfriend. 
But a friend of Tara's said: "In the final months she barely left her flat and had never mentioned a boyfriend. 
"The fact she was only seen with this guy in pubs or when he ­visited her flat at odd hours makes me fear he may have been helping her get drugs again." 
On Friday, Tara's sister Santa Montefiore visited the home where she was found dead. 
The author was seen on the phone in an upstairs window, and appeared understandably emotional. She is mourning the loss of her late sibling (Photo: TIM ANDERSON/Daily Mirror) She arrived at the property on Friday (Photo: TIM ANDERSON/Daily Mirror) 
It comes after she paid a heartbreaking tribute to the late socialite. 
Santa took to social media to share a glamorous picture of the former 'It girl' with her following, alongside an emotional message. 
Writing next to the black and white snap - posted just days after it was revealed Tara had been found dead by her cleaner - she said: "My darling sister. I miss you. #TaraPalmerTomkinson #tpt #rip (sic)" Santa paid tribute to Tara with this post (Photo: Twitter/@SantaMontefiore) 
It comes after Santa gave fans an insight into what it was like growing up with Tara. 
She was known for her outlandish behaviour and hedonistic lifestyle during her rise to fame, and her sister has revealed that her antics came as no surprise. Tara was the naughtier one of the pair (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
